channel.title: Gameframe problems.. I dont understand the methods quite well
channel.description:
Ive been working on it a while, still searching for every posible clue, but i cannot get this game frame I borrowed from icerealm to work,
[IMG]http://i241.photobucket.com/albums/ff6/mprock3/Tehsprites.jpg[/img]
Btw, dont call me a damn leecher im borrowing these sprites to test if they work or not then ill use their image size to create my own gameframe and whatnot.
It seems to be coming down to a method I can't figure out,
[code]aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_1198 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2(class44_2, "chatback", 0);[/code]
if I define and rewrite everything as so:
[code]aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_1198 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1(class44_2, "chatback", 0);[/code]
It gives me an incompatible type error, requesting
[code]aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_1198[/code]
If you have experience inputting a gameframe, please explain how this should be done and teach me, if no one comes, i'll get it eventualy lol. ( I hope? )

item.title: Gameframe problems.. I dont understand the methods quite well

Yeah, obviosly he said that >_<

item.title: Gameframe problems.. I dont understand the methods quite well
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

You need to use method 348 to display the sprites as opposed to method 361 if they’re class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.

Read full topic
item.source: Gameframe problems.. I dont understand the methods quite well

item.title: Gameframe problems.. I dont understand the methods quite well
item.dc:creator: @hippie hippie
item.description:
@hippie wrote:

Meh, thanks, I redid w/e i did and it r worked. I <3 you

item.source: Gameframe problems.. I dont understand the methods quite well

item.title: Gameframe problems.. I dont understand the methods quite well
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

Forgive me if I’m wrong on the following, but I haven’t worked with RS2 clients for some time now.

Hm… How can I explain this…
See the ‘identifier’ for that object? Or I should say ID? It’s 1198. Every time you see something like Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_1198 change it to Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_1198. Now find where it’s initialized (towards the bottom of the code) and make sure it creates the object from that class as well, not the previous one (Sub1_Sub2).

Read full topic
item.source: Gameframe problems.. I dont understand the methods quite well
